docs.lead_paragraph: There was a very large meeting of Republicans at Cooper Institute last evening, to listen to that noted political exhorter and prairie orator, ABE LINCOLN, Of Illinois. Mr. WILLIAM CULLEN BRYANT presided. The speaker, as soon as he appeared upon the platform, was vehemently cheered, and during the delivery of his address frequently applauded. His text lay in the sentiment of Senator ...

headline.main: FROM CALIFORNIA.; The Weather and the Country--Business-- Removal of the capital--Legal Prospecting--The New Almaden Mine--The Wonders of washoe--Departure of SenatorLatham. SAN FRANCISCO TOPICS. THE VISION FROM BRODERICK'S GRAVE--LONE MOUNTAIN AND YERBA BUENA CEMETERIES-- CHINESE BURIAL CUSTOMS--DEAD COOLIES CARRIED AS PASSENGERS TO CHINA--A NOTABLE FOG--COMPARATIYE CRIME OF SAN FRANCISCO AND NEW-YORK-- A BIT OF BOASTING, ETC.

docs.lead_paragraph: I am really and truly sorry for people that are not in California to-day, and have not been for the past month--they deserve sympathy, and are to be commisserated; for the weather has been glorious. The pleasantest June day with you, cannot excel our atmosphers about these days. Warm, sunny, so genial,--and so comfortable to drop your hat over one eye to shade the face, lean against a corner with a ...

headline.main: From Our Albany Correspondent.; AN AVALACHE OF PETITIONS--DIVORCE AMONG THE INDIANS--SOLID MEN OF NEW-YORK--THE DEATH PENALTY AND INTOXICATING DRINKS-- ABOLISHING THE ALMSHOUSE DEPARTMENT-- INCREASE OF THE RATES OF WHARFAGE--GOVERNOR CHASE IN ALBANY--A WINTER RAINBOW, &C. EXTENSION OF THE FOR COLLECTING TAXES-- PRESERVING THE BIRDS AND FISHES--STATEN ISLAND FERRY--A NEW CITY DEPARTMENT-- DAMAGES AT QUARANTINE--THE CENTRAL PARK --MORE CITY RAILROADS--GOV. CHASE, ETC., ETC.

docs.lead_paragraph: Members come back from their constituents loaded down with all kinds of papers known to legislation. Petitions, remonstrances, notices, bills, etc., lay around loose everywhere. More than an hour was occupied this morning in transferring petitions, alone, from the cabinets of the members to that vast vortex, the Clerk's desk.

docs.snippet: We hale already announced the recent death, at Florence, Italy, of THOS. A. TEFFT, Esq., of Richmond Rhode Island, at the early age of 32--a man who, if he had lived, would have achieved marked distinction in the special department of science to...

headline.main: Death of Thomas A. Tefft, Esq.

docs.lead_paragraph: We hale already announced the recent death, at Florence, Italy, of THOS. A. TEFFT, Esq., of Richmond Rhode Island, at the early age of 32--a man who, if he had lived, would have achieved marked distinction in the special department of science to which he had devoted liimself, and would have proved inferior to few in the genial sister-branch of literature, or in the less attractive domain of social science.

docs.snippet: THE CANALIZATION OF BROADWAY.--Now that we have had two consecutive days of good weather, broken in upon by only one brief shower of rain, it is simply reasonable to look immediately for a terrible gale, and for the heaviest snow-storm of the season.
docs.lead_paragraph: THE CANALIZATION OF BROADWAY.--Now that we have had two consecutive days of good weather, broken in upon by only one brief shower of rain, it is simply reasonable to look immediately for a terrible gale, and for the heaviest snow-storm of the season.

docs.snippet: The steamship Vigo, from Liverpool on the 8th, and the mails by the Europa which left the same port three days later, reached this City last evening. The news had been mainly anticipated by telegraph, but we add details of interest.
docs.lead_paragraph: The steamship Vigo, from Liverpool on the 8th, and the mails by the Europa which left the same port three days later, reached this City last evening. The news had been mainly anticipated by telegraph, but we add details of interest.

docs.snippet: Stone pavements are generally supposed to be much cheaper than iron:--yet we are quite inclined to believe that the aggregate expense of keeping Broadway well paved with stone for a hundred years, would be a million dollars more than the cost of...
docs.lead_paragraph: Stone pavements are generally supposed to be much cheaper than iron:--yet we are quite inclined to believe that the aggregate expense of keeping Broadway well paved with stone for a hundred years, would be a million dollars more than the cost of paving it with iron during the same period.
